title: Pledge to Mobilize: Defend our Reproductive Rights
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: On Friday, October 1st, The Handmaids are rallying from 12:00pm - 1:00pm ahead of the Supreme Court reconvening on October 4th. Women's March and more than 90 other organizations, including National Latina Institute for Reproductive Health, Planned Parenthood, SHERO Mississippi, Mississippi in Action, Access Reproductive Care-Southeast, The Frontline, Working Families Party, and SisterSong, are organizing a national call to mobilize and defend our reproductive rights.  Abortion has never been fully accessible, but we are at the risk of losing our reproductive freedom completely. The call to action is clear, and urgent. The relentless attacks from Texas to Mississippi are ramping up quickly. Anti-choice extremists have a deep desire to return to a time when there was more clear and effective domination and control over queer and trans folks, women, and people of color; they want to revive those old values and societal norms to the point of re-acceptance. The authoritarian agenda of reproductive control is fueled by misogyny and racism - and we must challenge it, together.  On October 1st, we’re going to send the Supreme Court and lawmakers across the country a clear, unified message. The attack on our reproductive rights will not be tolerated.  We have this opportunity to invite all the people that know us and love us into this important movement and work united as we build something better for our families and communities. As a small powerful group tries to come for our human rights over and over again, we’ll never let go of our vision of reproductive justice; for unfettered abortion access and everything we need to support and grow our families to thrive and live healthy lives.  This is your fight. This is our fight. This impacts all of us. Pledge today to rally and rise up with the Handmaids on October 1st.  Please remember that we are still in a pandemic and your health, and that of those around you, is especially important. We are committed to maintaining public health measures to practice safe protesting during the pandemic. All event participants are expected to wear a mask, maintain social distancing, have weighed their own risk in attending, and follow all local safety guidelines at minimum, and any safety instructions from hosts that exceed local law.  As with our previous events, the same rules apply. We will not engage in any acts of violence or violation of any applicable laws or engage in civil disobedience. All actions will be peaceful. Everyone participating in this event will be required to behave lawfully to ensure the safety of event participants and will seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values. We will obey the orders of authorized event marshals and law enforcement authorities. Event organizers will not be responsible for any injury or damage if any were to occur during this event. We will park in the Courthouse parking lot without blocking access lanes and will remove any trash that is left.

title: Abilene Women’s March
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Reproductive Choice is not a Republican or Democrat issue. It is an issue that concerns us all.  On October 2nd, women, uterus owners, and those who love them will gather in the parking area of the Taylor County Courthouse in support of Reproductive Choice on October 2nd for a program of celebration and public testimony of the power of Choice in our lives.     We will then proceed through downtown Abilene, sending a message loud and clear to the US Supreme Court - that as “The Notorious” Ruth Bader Ginsburg once said: “The decision whether or not to bear a child is central to a woman's life, to her well-being and dignity. It is a decision she must make for herself.”     Attendees can participate in car procession to City Hall or march around the Courthouse on the sidewalk socially distanced.    Also, as reproductive choice is pre-requisite to the wellbeing of Democracy, so too is public health and safety. We will require all participants and attendees to follow the most recent CDC Guidelines, to mask and social distance responsibly, to help stop the spread of Covid-19.     Car decorating (first come first served) and voter registration will both be available before the event. Take note that there is no public restroom but port-a-potty will be on premises for public use.    Pro-Choice is Pro-Life. We hope you can join us!

title: Ohio to Texas stop the Bans
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: On September 1, Senate Bill 8 went into effect in Texas. SB 8 is a new Texas law that bans Texans' from accessing abortion services after six weeks. Most people don't even know they are pregnant at six weeks!  It also allows private citizens in Texas the power to sue someone who provides an abortion or helps someone get an abortion outside of the 6 week restriction for at least a $10,000 bounty!  Texas' passing of this law serves as a test for other states to follow with similar laws, specifically Ohio. We have already seen similar bans show up locally in Ohio. Therefore, we are taking a stand so people in Texas and everywhere else can have access to abortion care!  Come out and take a stand for safe, legal abortion access! Bring posters, bring friends, let your voice be heard!  Event hosted by: Big Love Network, Dimensions of Isms, and Planned Parenthood Advocates of Ohio

title: March for Reproductive Freedom
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: The Texas GOP, along with Alabama and other red states have passed laws taking away women's rights to their own reproductive decisions. Join us to tell the GOP that "We Will Not Go Back"!! Let your voices be heard!  Our very own "rock star" activist for Women's Rights, Lilly Ledbetter, will be with us to kick off the march with greetings of encouragement and strength.  We will gather in an open area on the northwest corner of Hwy 202 and Noble Street at 11:00 a.m. There is parking available in the old Winn Dixie parking lot, right next to the gathering area. We will march a few blocks north to the Federal Court House on the corner of 12th Street West and Noble St. Since we do not meet the criteria of a 30 day wait time to secure a permit from the city, we will at all times conduct ourselves in a lawful, peaceful manner. We must walk only on the sidewalks, allowing any pedestrians to pass and we will obey traffic signals and we will not block traffic nor march in the streets. Bring your own sign! This event is open to all women who believe in a woman's right to control her own healthcare and reproductive decisions.  This is not a political issue and this is not a political event.  This is an issue that affects every woman of childbearing age, regardless of race, economic standing or political persuasion.  Come join us and make a statement!!  We will be observing COVID safety precautions.  We require you wear masks and social distance as much as possible.  We will have additional masks and hand sanitizer if needed.   If you have questions, you can call or text: Sheila, 256-310-0955, or Beverly, 256-225-3096, Carsie, 256-225-7032, or Dee, 256-239-5481.

title: Feminism Beyond White Supremacy
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: We must understand that feminism is needed to liberate ourselves from white supremacy, colonialism, imperialism, and capitalism. The feminist movement while pioneered by Black women now centers white women.     A feminist future is only achievable if it includes everyone. The intersection of race, class, sexuality, and gender is the foundation of that future.     On October 2nd, we march for liberation and our futures without oppressive laws like the Texas abortion law that will disproportionately affect Black women and low-income communities.

location: North Forest St and Ellis St
title: Unite for Abortion Justice
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: On September 1, the U.S. Supreme Court allowed Texas’ six-week abortion ban to take effect, eliminating abortion services for 90% of those in need. Since then, patients across Texas have been scared, confused, and left with nowhere to turn in accessing safe, legal abortion in their home state. This is a travesty, and outraged Planned Parenthood allies and supporters like you are ready to take action!    Please join us on Saturday, October 2nd from 12:30pm – 1:30pm at the corner of North Forest and Ellis cross streets in Bellingham. There, you will be invited to join us for a show of support by lining our sidewalk outside the health center, showing up for our right to control our own bodies and futures. Signs will be provided as we take to a march that starts at 2:00pm at Bellingham City Hall, where we march in solidarity with Texans to fight to protect abortion access across the country.    Masks are required regardless of vaccination status.

title: Defend Reproductive Rights Rally
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: MASKS ARE REQUIRED!!  BRING SIGNS!    On October 2, we're marching in every single state ahead of the Supreme Court reconvening on October 4.   Women's March and more than 90 other organizations, including National Latina Institute for Reproductive Justice, Planned Parenthood, SHERO Mississippi, Mississippi in Action, Access Reproductive Care-Southeast, The Frontline, Working Families Party, and SisterSong, are organizing a national call to mobilize and defend our reproductive rights.    Abortion has never been fully accessible, but we are at the risk of losing our reproductive freedom completely. The call to action is clear, and urgent. The relentless attacks from Texas to Mississippi are ramping up quickly. Anti-choice extremists have a deep desire to return to a time when there was more clear and effective domination and control over queer and trans folks, women, and people of color; they want to revive those old values and societal norms to the point of re-acceptance. The authoritarian agenda of reproductive control is fueled by misogyny and racism - and we must challenge it, together.    On October 2, we’re going to send the Supreme Court and lawmakers across the country a clear, unified message. The attack on our reproductive rights will not be tolerated.    We have this opportunity to invite all the people that know us and love us into this important movement and work united as we build something better for our families and communities. As a small powerful group tries to come for our human rights over and over again, we’ll never let go of our vision of reproductive justice; for unfettered abortion access and everything we need to support and grow our families to thrive and live healthy lives.    This is your fight. This is our fight. This impacts all of us. Take the pledge today. Rise up wherever you are on October 2.

Join us at on Saturday October 2nd at three different locations:    <U+2B50><U+FE0F>Downtown City Plaza    <U+2B50><U+FE0F>3rd & Main with the Chico Peace Endeavor Vigil     <U+2B50><U+FE0F>Chico Farmers Market     Bring your signs, family, friends and community to make your voice heard!       **********************************************    ?COVID safety minded and social distanced grassroots, inclusive events.    ?These are Family friendly, elder friendly, inclusive, wheelchair and assistive equipment accessible events. Additional accessibility info tba in the fb invite below.     ?All events will be observing COVID-19 Safety precautions.  For outdoor events and actions please wear masks, coverings and other PPE where needed to help stop the spread of the virus.     **********************************************    CARAVAN INFO ? Caravan email sign up & for more info: chicowomenmarch@gmail.com    VOLUNTEER INFO ? Want to Volunteer? Email at: VolunteerWMChico@gmail.com    FB RSVP & More Event Details here:    Like and follow our page:  https://www.facebook.com/WomensMarchChicoOfficial/    For more on Women’s March, the Womens’s Agenda and Justice movements please go to:  https://womensmarch.com/    **********************************************  Save the Date!    Abortion is essential health care.     Women’s March networks across the country are taking action on 10/2 in every single state to defend and protect abortion access.    Women’s March Chico in partnership with WORD: Women On Reproductive Defense and a growing Repro Justice Coalition will hold local rapid response actions on Oct 2.    Join local communities and groups showing up in solidarity and positive support together for Oct 2: Caravan for Repro Justice NOW    Local Oct 2 Rapid response actions are being planned in consideration of all of our communities’ pandemic safety, and our ongoing fire season.     As well, it’s a tremendous amount of labor, preparation and expense to host a standard March.    For these reasons we will join in community with folks taking Repro Rights Action every state for Caravan and Sign Actions Downtown Chico on Oct 2nd    We want folks to show up for Reproductive Justice with high visibility and community safety in mind!     In the meantime as tens of thousands Womens March supporters look ahead to Saturday October 2nd, RSVP and sign up below and take the pledge to take action—because it’s time to show up for reproductive rights:     #CaravanForReproJustice #SignsForReproJustice  #ReproJustice #ReproRights  #ReproHealth #ReproWellness  #ReproductiveJustice #ReproductiveFreedom  #AbortionIsEssential #AbortionIsHealthcare  #AbortionisEssentialHealthcare  #AbortionCare #ProtectAbortionAccess  #ReproAutonomy #ReproAccess  #ConsentCulture #EndAbuseCulture  #WomensRightsAreHumanRights  #ReproRightsAreHumanRights  #UpliftWomensRightsReproRightHumanRights  #OurBodiesOurReproHealth  #KeepAbortionSafeandLegal  #MyReproHealthMyChoice  #MyBodyMYCHOICE  #OurBodiesOurReproRights  #ProChoice ProChoiceAndProud  #ProChoiceFamilies  #CHOICE #PROCHOICE #ACCESS  #WeWillNeverGoBack  #BodyAutonomy  #WomensHealthProtectionAct  #ReproRights #ReproAction  #ReproductiveJusticeNOW  #ReproRightsNOW  #ReproAccessForAll  #ReproWellnessForAll  #ReproJusticeForAll  #HealthCareForAll  #BasicHealthCareNOW  #NoSB8 #ERANow  #Grassroots #Community #Coalition  #OrganizeAndWin #MobilizeAndDefend  #TimeToShowUpForReproJustice  #WomensMarchChico   #WORD #WomenOnReproductiveDefense  #ReproJusticeCoalition  #Oct2 #WomensMarch          **********************************************    RISING UP FOR REPRO JUSTICE:  Texas’ new anti-abortion law, like other abortion bans, denies access to critical health care to Women and people who can give birth, especially vulnerable communities like young people, BIPOC Black, Indigenous and People of Color, LGBTQ+ people, poor and low income people, people with disabilities, marginalized people, abuse survivors, and all who as a result of these attempted human rights violations may have to resort to traveling far and wide for essential Abortion Care, or worse: turn to dangerous, illegal abortions. #WeRise4ReproJustice    SB8, is the culmination of growing authoritarianism and long-simmering misogyny in the country, especially enabled within the GOP #ENOUGH    We have to unite and fight for reproductive justice.    We must end attempts to deny basic reproductive rights and repro access for all— and communities are going to do everything possible to fight back and protect Abortion access as essential healthcare. #WeWontStop    In early September Womens March national chapter in DC announced the call to action for mass mobilization on 10/2 to defend abortion access and our reproductive freedom.    Since then, tend of thousands of Women’s Marchers in all 50 states have already signed the pledge to volunteer and join together and over 90 Reproductive Rights groups are partnering to stand strong.     We’re rising up and making ourselves loud and clear: we won’t tolerate attacks on abortion access.     Period.    The movement for Reproductive Justice is only growing.    Join us as we stand in together solidarity across the country on October 2nd!

title: Women's March Cleveland October 2, 2021 march for reproductive & Civil Rights
organizations: Women's March Cleveland; International Women's Day March Cleveland; Planned Parenthood; Imperial Women Coalition; Black Women's PAC of Greater Cleveland; Cuyahoga County Democratic Women's Caucus; National Congress of Black Women greater Cleveland chapter; Peace Action; Greater Cleveland Immigrant Support Network; Refusefacism; Clevelandurbannews.com; Black on Black Crime Inc; Black Man's Army; Greater Cleveland Independent Black Journalists; Brickhouse Wellness Center; Carl Stokes Brigade; End Poverty Now Cleveland
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: This is an in-person rally and march in Cleveland, Ohio on Oct 2, 2021: Contact tel: Women's March Cleveland (216) 659-0473. Calling on all women across racial, ethic, socioeconomic, religious and gender lines, and their supporters. This event will begin with a noon rally on Market Square followed by a 1:30 pm march.  Event address: Market Square Park across from the West Side Market in Cleveland at the corner of W 25th Street and Lorain Avenue.  Women's March Cleveland will join cities nationwide and Women's March National in Washington, D.C. to host a local rally and march in Cleveland.  The event is a rally and march for reproductive and Civil rights  in the midst of the recent Texas court ruling against reproductive rights and the attack on Roe v. Wade by the conservative right and state legislatures across the country.     The Women's March will convene mass mobilization events next month in city's nationwide to protest this controversial new abortion law in Texas and to fight against such type of laws popping up in other states. No doubt, Ohio is at risk for such a proposed law that might be offered by lawmakers in its state legislature. in fact such-type bills have been introduced in at least six other states since this most recent Texas law against abortion took effect. Ohio tried this previously with the heartbeat bill and its restrictions on abortion and later lost in the courts  . A woman's right to choose what happens with her body, whether in Ohio or elsewhere, is a constitutional right per the 1973  landmark Supreme Court decision in Roe v. Wade. that made abortion legal nationwide.      Why our fight matters: The Texas law bans abortions after six weeks and does not exempt cases of rape or incest. Considered one of the most restrictive abortion laws in the U.S. since the 1973 Roe v. Wade decision, the new law has incited widespread outrage among abortion-rights advocates.    Details: Women's March and over 90 other organizations are organizing a national call to mobilize on Oct. 2 and "defend our reproductive rights." We will hold marches in "every single state" ahead of the Supreme Court reconvening on Oct. 4 On this date the Supreme Court will hear oral arguments in an abortion rights case out of Jackson, Mississippi.    Also at issue is violence against women and the attack on voting rights and on Civil Rights in general against women, Blacks, people of color, poor people, and others across the country. We will fight for the voting, civil and reproductive rights of women in Cleveland, in greater Cleveland, in Ohio, and in the country. And we want jobs, and equal pay as well as a minimum wage and access to quality healthcare. We want safe and affordable housing, criminal justice reform, educational equity and fair redistricting of congressional and state house and senate districts in Ohio. We call for police to value Black lives as if they were their own, and we support the LGBTQ community. We denounce mass incarceration, racism, sexism, excessive force,  religious bigotry, and discrimination in any form or fashion.    A list of speakers for the event is forthcoming. In addition to the host group of Women's March Cleveland, other participating groups for Women's March Cleveland's Oct 2, 2021 march include International Women's Day March Cleveland, Planned Parenthood at the national level, Imperial Women Coalition, Black Women's PAC of greater Cleveland, Cuyahoga County Democratic Women's Caucus, National Congress of Black Women greater Cleveland chapter,  Refusefacism, Clevelandurbannews.com,  Greater Cleveland Independent Black Journalists, Brickhouse Wellness Center, the Carl Stokes Brigade, End Poverty Now Cleveland, and more.    Please wear masks to this event. Thank you for your cooperation.  Here is the link for the Facebook event page for Cleveland's Oct 2, 2021 rally and march beginning at noon on Market Square: https://www.facebook.com/events/503532004087005/?ref=newsfeed

title: Denton March to Defend Abortion Rights (Official)
organizations: PRO Gainesville; Black Rights Organization; Denton County Democratic Party; Texas Equal Access Fund
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: This March was organized via a coalition of representatives from activist organizations across Denton County, including TEA Fund, the only grassroots non-profit abortion fund already serving as THE LIFELINE for North Texans needing assistance with abortion access.     Join Denton County residents in solidarity with people nationwide to march to #DefendAbortion on 10/2!     Our march will begin on the south lawn of the Denton County Courthouse at 1PM and will be 1.5-3 three miles long with several stops along the way for rest, guest speakers, and water.     MARCH LEADERS / SPEAKERS:  Torreylynne Henderson (PRO Gainesville)  Zan Hollister (BRO - Black Rights Organization)  Delashawn Bordeaux, (www.speakourtruth.org)  Delia Parker-Mims (Community Advocate and Candidate, Denton County Democratic Party Chair)  TEA Fund Representatives and more     IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR ATTENDEES:  - WEAR A MASK when within six feet of others. Masks will be available for those who forget or need replacements.  - ORGANIZERS REQUEST NO OPEN DISPLAYS OF WEAPONS OF ANY KIND. This is a non-violent solidarity march.   - PLEASE BRING YOUR OWN WATER BOTTLES! Water refill stations will be available throughout the duration of the march but we discourage the use of disposable water bottle distribution.       *** Please note that as the individuals most as risk via these most harsh restrictions on reproductive rights in Texas, the voices of BIPOC & LGBTQIA individuals with uteruses will be prioritized as guest speakers but anyone in speaking, as well as anyone interested in volunteering for first aid /water support, and those seeking more information should email jessica@directactionforachange.com

We will be gathering to voice our dissent for this decision and to advocate for reproductive rights for all. Then take to the sidewalks of downtown with our signs and voices held high.     Let's show up in numbers the public can't ignore & make this the best Women's March to date.

title: It’s our bodies
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: This moment demands that we fight for a future where abortion care is there for everyone who needs it. We know #AbortionJustice can’t wait. #RallyforAbortionJustice on October 2 at 1pm. We are rallying in every state to send our message; attacks on our reproductive freedom won’t be tolerated

location: Spirit of Detroit Statue, 2 Woodward Ave
title: Reproductive Rights March
claims: for free abortion on demand without apology, against Texas abortion ban, against all restrictions on abortion, for passage of the Black Maternal Health Momnibus Act, Black Lives Matter, Stop Asian Hate, for LGBTQ+ rights, for expanded sex education, for free contraception for all, for improving foster care, for state paid maternity care, for legalizing sex work
notes: The Texas abortion ban, and the Supreme Court’s refusal to block this unconstitutional law and political loophole will be the de facto end of Roe vs. Wade unless we act now. Other states, including Arkansas, Florida, South Carolina, South Dakota, Kentucky, Louisiana, Oklahoma, and Ohio have already declared their intention to follow Texas’ example.     Lower courts are bound by Supreme Court decisions unless they are overturned. Roe v. Wade is still the law of the land. We repudiate the Texas abortion ban and the Illegitimate Supreme Court that won’t even enforce it’s own precedent by striking down the Texas ban.     Because Republicans know that a majority of Americans support the right to abortion, their strategy is to make this end-run around established judicial precedent. Their strategy is to limit the right to the abortion so fully as to be equatable with a ban on abortion. They are also dangerously encouraging vigilante behavior among an already radicalized right, turning neighbor against neighbor, and luring people to turn each other in to the government for cash in this Covid-ravaged economy.      The wealthy will always have access to abortion. They can fly, they can pay. It is disproportionately women of color, poor women, and other marginalized people, including trans men and non-binary people, who will be denied access.     The openly partisan, extreme-right Supreme Court built by Trump is illegitimate. Sexual offender Brett Kavanaugh will NEVER tell us what we can and can’t do with our bodies.     The Black Lives Matter movement which shook America last summer showed us the way. Our power is in the streets.     The Women’s Movement in 2016 also gave us a glimpse of our potential power, before it was diverted into electoral politics-as-usual.     Trusting our fates to the Supreme Court or the equally flawed parties of the “Two Party System” Democrats or Republicans is a failed strategy. Abortion rights have been eroded for decades. The Democrats haven’t passed any federal legislation to protect us for 40 years--even when they had super majorities. Republicans have also failed us with abortion rights for obvious reasons such as mixing church and state and passing consistently unjust laws against reproductive rights.     It is time to build a new abortion rights movement, fighting in the streets and overcoming every obstacle to our ability to live a free and meaningful life. Hand in hand with our siblings of every race, nationality, gender, and sexual identity, we pledge to organize and fight until this world is worthy of us.     Join us on October 2nd for a march, open mic, and a mass strategy meeting to defend our right to abortion. Come with your proposals, votes will be taken on the best way forward.     Our Demands:  Free abortion on demand, without apology  Defend Roe v. Wade  Down with the Texas abortion ban  Down with all restrictions on abortion  Black Lives Matter  Stop Asian Hate  Our trans family is welcome here  We call on all people of conscience to defy this illegitimate Supreme Court   Demand Michigan to put sanctions on Texas until the abortion law is overturned   Expand sex education  Free contraception for all   Improve foster care   State paid maternity care

location: Old BC Courthouse, 55 E Court St
title: Bans Off Our Bodies Rally - Doylestown
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: On October 2, we’re rising up for reproductive rights, at the Bucks County Courthouse lawn, on this national day of solidarity with thousands of people in every single state, ahead of the Supreme Court reconvening on October 4. Youth4Unity, Rise Up Doylestown, NAACP Bucks County, Planned Parenthood Keystone, Bucks Liberation Coalition, Central Bucks YDSA, Bucks County Women’s Advocacy Coalition, and many other partnered organizations are part of this call to mobilize and defend our reproductive rights.     Abortion has never been fully accessible, but we are at the risk of losing our reproductive freedom completely. The call to action is clear, and urgent. The relentless attacks from Texas to Mississippi to Pennsylvania are ramping up quickly. Anti-choice extremists have a deep desire to return to a time when there was more clear and effective domination and control over queer and trans folks, women, and people of color; they want to revive those old values and societal norms to the point of re-acceptance. The authoritarian agenda of reproductive control is fueled by misogyny and racism - and we must challenge it, together.    On October 2, we’re going to send the Supreme Court and lawmakers across the country a clear, unified message. The attack on our reproductive rights will not be tolerated.    We have this opportunity to invite all the people that know us and love us into this important movement and work united as we build something better for our families and communities. As a small powerful group tries to come for our human rights over and over again, we’ll never let go of our vision of reproductive justice; for unfettered abortion access and everything we need to support and grow our families to thrive and live healthy lives.    This is your fight. This is our fight. This impacts all of us. Rise up with us in Doylestown or wherever you are on October 2.      #bansoffourbodies  #defendabortion

title: Our Future, Our Choice | Mi Futuro En Mis Manos
organizations: Women's March; Planned Parenthood of Greater Texas
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: FRONTERA PRESENTE!    On September 1, 2021, the extreme and unconstitutional abortion ban known as SB8 went in to effect in Texas. The law bans abortion after approximately six weeks gestation, before most people even know they are pregnant. The law also allows any private citizen from anywhere in the country to sue any person- a doctor, a sister, a brother, a mother, a friend- who helps a person access an abortion in Texas after six weeks.  This law, along with the extremists who support it, actively encourages private citizens to insert themselves into the private medical decisions of other private citizens for a cash payout.  Restrictions like Texas’ new abortion ban are designed to control, stigmatize, and create a reality where your zip code determines whether you can access abortion. In El Paso, we have been fighting for equitable access for generations and we will continue fighting now.  We believe in a future where no person is faced with shame or fear when seeking safe, legal health care. We believe in a future in which every person has the opportunity to live their lives and make health decisions that are best for themselves and their families.  We thank the organizers and partners who have walked with us to this moment and call on our border community to join us as we march for choice. For our future.  #ourfuture #ourchoice #mifuturo #bansoffourbodies #ppgt

title: Fairbanks Day of Action to Protect Abortion
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: I’m going to be honest with you. Our right to access safe, legal abortion is in the most serious danger it has been in 48 years. Almost 5 decades ago, the Supreme Court said that your constitutional right to privacy extended to your right to access an abortion. This year, the Supreme Court reconvenes on October 4th and will be hearing a case on a 15-week abortion ban in Mississippi. With the addition of three new conservative justices it is possible the court will overturn all or parts of Roe v Wade and eliminate access to safe and legal abortion for millions across the country.  The devastating abortion ban we saw enacted in Texas last week is just one of over 90 egregious and harmful anti-abortion bills enacted across the country this year alone, with over 400 more bills in state legislatures right now-- including one in Alaska to amend our State Constitution. Abortion rights across the United States-- including here in Alaska-- are under attack. But we’re not giving up.    Mark your calendars for Planned Parenthood Alliance Advocates - Alaska’s statewide DAY OF ACTION on Saturday October 2nd. We will be holding events in communities across the state! We look forward to finding ways to safely support each other, get loud, find joy and catharsis, and tell our legislators across Alaska to keep their #BansOffOurBodies!    We will be releasing more details soon! Please spread the word and invite your friends, family, lovers, classmates, etc to help us get loud and protect our right to SAFE, LEGAL abortion! If you’re interested in volunteering or want to help in other ways, please fill out this quick form and we will be in touch! See you there!!!    https://forms.gle/JfZxPwuAWgkiQo6a7

title: Gunnison Valley Women's March
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: We are inviting all Gunnison Valley community members to stand with Women on October 2, 2021 in Gunnison, Colorado.  This local march is an extension of the national Women's March organization and corresponding mission. Women across the US are peacefully demonstrating on Saturday, October 2nd ahead of the Supreme Court reconvening on Monday, October 4th. This peaceful demonstration is a March in support of women's reproductive rights, ending violence against women, civil rights, immigrant rights, and disability rights, among many other concerns. Read more here: https://womensmarch.com/mission-and-principles  Mission: The mission of Women’s March is to harness the political power of diverse women and their communities to create transformative social change. Women’s March is a women-led movement providing intersectional education on a diverse range of issues and creating entry points for new grassroots activists & organizers to engage in their local communities through trainings, outreach programs and events. Women’s March is committed to dismantling systems of oppression through nonviolent resistance and building inclusive structures guided by self-determination, dignity and respect.     Please bring water, sunscreen, hat, and comfortable walking shoes. Also, don't forget your signs! We will be marching up and down the Main Street of Gunnison. Following the march, we will have a number of speakers from our local community around the Gazebo. We hope you can bring some lunch or a small picnic with you and enjoy the park with your friends, family, and community following the event, weather permitting :)     We will also have a letter writing table, and some additional resources and next steps to take following the event!     Please reach out if you have any questions.

title: Bans Off Our Bodies March & Rally
organizations: Planned Parenthood Keystone; League of Women Voters of Pennsylvania; Pennsylvania Religious Coalition for Reproductive Justice; WOMEN'S WAY; Central Pennsylvania Anti-Violence Project; YWCA Lancaster; Schuylkill County Democratic Women's League
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Join Planned Parenthood Keystone, Women's Way, and our community partners for a march and rally for abortion justice on Saturday, October 2nd from 11am-1pm!    Pennsylvania and states across the nation will be mobilizing to demand abortion justice. We understand the significance that bans like SB8 and the impending SCOTUS decision out of Mississippi will have on our state and across the US. And we know how important it is to stand in solidarity and send a message to our state legislature in PA that we will fight back. It is vitally important that we connect what is happening in Texas and Mississippi to what has been introduced already and what's to come in our own state. Sign up to join us on October 2nd to let our opposition know: Bans Off Our Bodies!    Please note: We will be following strict COVID-19 safety procotol. Participants are required to wear a mask at all times and socially distance where possible. Additionally, this is event advocates for abortion justice for ALL FOLKS!      See our Facebook event page here: https://www.facebook.com/events/554056719253516      Pledge to join us, sign up to volunteer, or sign up to be an event partner here: https://bit.ly/BansOffOurBodiesPA      For questions, please contact volunteer@ppkeystone.org. For media inquiries, please contat media@ppkeystone.org.      For COVID-19 Safety Guidance, please visit: https://www.pa.gov/guides/responding-to-covid-19/      For information about protesters' rights, visit: https://www.aclu.org/know-your-rights/protesters-rights/      Participation in this event, “Bans Off Our Bodies March and Rally”, carries with it inherent risks related to the COVID-19 transmission that cannot be eliminated regardless of the care taken to avoid such risks. By participating in the event, you voluntarily accept and assume all risk of loss, personal injury, sickness, death, damage, and expense arising out of such inherent risks for yourself and your children, if applicable. Event participants forever release and waive their right to bring suit on their behalf and on their child(s) behalf against PPKeystone, and its owners, officers, directors, managers, officials, agents, employees, or other representatives in connection with exposure, infection, and/or spread of COVID-19 related to attending the event.

title: Reclaiming our Freedoms!
organizations: Houston Women March On; Planned Parenthood Generation Action; Hoochies of Houston
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: SIGN UP | STAND UP: HOUSTON WOMEN’S MARCH IS OCT. 2    HOUSTON WOMEN AND ALLIES TO GATHER AT DISCOVERY GREEN AND MARCH TO CITY HALL IN PEACEFUL PROTEST WITH SHARED FOCUS ON VOTER REGISTRATION     WHAT: The Houston Women’s March will bring together women and allies for a peaceful protest on Saturday, October 2, 2021. Participants will gather at Discovery Green and then march to Houston City Hall beginning at 9 a.m. The event will also include voter registration stations, speakers, and musical performances. Details will be announced soon.      WHEN: Saturday, October 2, 2021, at 9 a.m. Participants will begin gathering at Discovery Green at 7 a.m.     WHERE: START: Discovery Green (1500 McKinney St., Houston, TX 77010)    END: Houston City Hall (901 Bagby St., Houston, TX 77002)    The Houston Women’s March will serve as a peaceful protest of dire current events in Texas, including Senate Bill 8, which is tantamount to an unconstitutional ban on abortion; recently passed voter suppression laws; redistricting measures; discriminatory proposals harming the trans community; the inhumane treatment of immigrants along the border and throughout the state; attacks on Asian Americans; and so much more.     Voter stations will be set up to encourage registration, inclusion, and participation in the election process.    For more details: https://actionnetwork.org/events/reclaiming-our-freedom?source=direct_link&

title: Jacksonville's Our Body Our Choice
organizations: Women's March Jacksonville; Jacksonville Community Action Committee
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights, against HB 167 in Florida
notes: Our Body – Our Choice – Now Is the Time to Act!    When the Supreme Court rejected an emergency request to block Texas's abortion ban, they effectively took the next step towards overturning Roe v. Wade. Ron DeSantis has already expressed his support of the Heartbeat bill, and Republican legislators have verbalized their support. We must defend our reproductive rights! Right now, across this state Republican leaders are taking actions to restrict a woman’s right to choose!    We must let our voices be heard!  Oct 2nd across the nation protests will be held to fight for our right to safe and effective reproductive health choices and to stand in solidarity with the women in Texas. On Oct 2nd we must demand a stop to Ron DeSantis's draft of his own Florida Heartbeat bill.    Jacksonville organizations are combining forces to host our own demonstrations to send a clear message to Florida legislators – “Our Body – Our Choice”.     Demonstration will consist of 3 parts: a caravan, a rally at the courthouse, and a march to City Hall.  Masks and social distancing are required. Please note that these events are not only for women, but for anyone who supports body autonomy. Anyone who supports reproductive rights is welcome to attend. Please RSVP to be added to our attendee list and receive updates as we get closer to the event.      You are welcome at all 3 events, or you can participate as you see fit.    Our Body - Our Choice Car Caravan    The car caravan is an excellent opportunity for those with COVID concerns or risks to join in the demonstration and experience little to no exposure to other participants.   All participants are asked to mask up when they are outside of their vehicles.    Car caravans will be initiated at various points across the city and converge on the Courthouse on Adams Street, where the Our Body- Our Choice Rally will be held.    Participants are asked to arrive by 9:15am to decorate their cars with signs and banners and line up in an orderly fashion.    Caravans will depart their start points at 10:00am and proceed at approximately 30-35mph through designated portions of town be fore they terminate at the Courthouse at 10:45am where participants can park and join in the Rally.     A complete list of the caravan start points will be announced on social media, and via email within the coming days.         Our Body- Our Choice Rally    The in-person rally will be held at 501 W. Adams St. and is slated to begin at 11:00am. The rally will feature legislative leaders, community organization leaders, and activists.  Stay tuned for a complete list of speakers.    Our Body- Our Choice March    After the rally we will march, carrying our message to City Hall for some unified chanting, and then march back to the courthouse for our final speakers. The march will start no later than 12:00pm.    After the march we encourage all participates who feel comfortable with public events to join in the River City Pride Festival. Let’s remember that Body Autonomy impacts all of us. Our right to choose, our body our choice, doesn’t apply just to women. While today’s fight might be reproductive rights, remember it is only one cog in the wheel of power and control that others seek to gain over us.        If you would like to volunteer for any of our events on October 2nd, please use the link below:  https://actionnetwork.org/forms/volunteer-sign-up-for-oct-2nd-2021-event?source=direct_link&

title: Reproductive Rights For All!
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Please join Matriarchy Rising & YPDA Big Island for a dynamic demonstration in solidarity with Texans who have lost their abortion rights. We are joining with national protests by the Women’s March and Planned Parenthood on the same day of Saturday, October 2nd. The protest will take place in Kailua-Kona at all four-corners of the intersection of Queen Ka’ahumanu HWY and Makala Blvd.  Several Kona artists and musicians have created large visual pieces and grounding chants for a surreal demonstration.  What to bring: masks, water, signs, drums & percussion.  Safety is Important: Masks are required as is social distancing. During the protest, we must stand in separate pods with our ohana/covid-bubble and stay distanced 20 feet apart from other pods. Pods can be no larger than 10 people. This event is not a march.  Saturday, October 2, 2021. From 3:00-4:30pm at the 4 corner intersection of Makala Blvd. and Queen Ka’ahumanu HWY in Kailua-Kona.  Park near the courthouse, above the Kona Commons Shopping Center, on the mauka side of the highway.  Wear pink to support Planned Parenthood!  Extra signs, masks, and water will be available.  This is a keiki friendly event to support Reproductive Freedom and Healthcare Access hosted by Matriarchy Rising & YPDA Big Island.  ------------------------------------  * This is a Covid-19 Safe Event where all will be required to wear masks and safely distance.  * Contact tracing methods will be in effect.  * If you feel ill, please stay home and join us through social media.  * This is a trans+non-binary inclusive event supporting reproductive rights for all people.

title: Kalamazoo Womens March for Reproductive Freedom
organizations: Women's March; Black Voters Matter Fund; Planned Parenthood
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights, against racism, for LGBTQ+ rights, for disabled peoples' rights
notes: The Women’s March will be at Bronson Park, 200 South Rose, Kalamazoo, Michigan 49007.  The purpose of this march is for women, men LGBTQIAt and all to stand up to say no to the laws Texas and other states are trying to enact to remove reproductive  health rights from women. It is important for us to take a stand as a community for reproductive freedoms.  Please join us.       Kalamazoo Women’s March for Reproductive Freedom, from Bronson Park on October 2nd  Speakers, music, marching and information tables     The organizers of the Kalamazoo Women’s March are working to create an event that not only defends the reproductive rights of all humans and to specifically affirm the resistance of harmful marginalization and bias against Black, Brown and Indigenous community members, members of the LGBTQIA+ community, as well as people with disabilities when it intercedes with this subject. We will march strongly together on October 2nd for the rights of ALL who need access to the full spectrum of reproductive healthcare, including abortion care, birth control, prenatal care and safe birthing, at their own self-determination.    This event is one within a group of over 540 National Women’s Marches, in every state, across the country taking place on October 2nd, for prochoice issues, in response to what happened in Texas.  https://womensmarch.com/ The key marches take place just two days before the Supreme Court is due to convene.     Date October 2, 12-2 :30, Bronson Park  https://www.facebook.com/events/565052081288983/?ref=newsfeed    Set up starts at 9 am   MC Stephanie Moore Williams  Wide range of speakers pre-march and post-march, including:   Julie Rogers Rep 60th District who has urged the Supreme Court to uphold Roe v Wade  Music: Velvettes are invited and hope to attend  Dr. Kate Cook, LGBTQR, also giving legal update on national political issues   Christine Morse State Rep 61st District, Personal Story and on Healthcare State Board will update on Michigan   Samara Woolfolk, Julia Serlin, Youth Speaker, sexual assault and harassment on college campuses   Denise Lee Miller, Poetry reading   Kim Jorgenson Gane;  Shardae Chambers from the Planned Parenthood Board and others.  Musicians, Lisa Mackie and Celeste Allison are local to Kalamazoo and are new to playing on stage together.  They both care deeply about reproductive rights.    There will also be DJ Chuck and a key range of other speakers.  The organizers will make sure that COVID procedures are followed with masks and hand sanitizers available for all.  There will also be a first aid table in place.      Women who want to join the Kalamazoo event as volunteers can sign up on Facebook at: Women’s March Volunteers  https://www.facebook.com/events/891022605124313/?ref=newsfeed and at a poster event here: https://www.facebook.com/events/399182165105233/?ref=newsfeed    Please join us Friday night at the sign making volunteer training at 7:00 on the first, at Choices For Change at 218 West Walnut.    https://fb.me/e/5xHzMOUzT    It is important to note that the march route is eight blocks through downtown Kalamazoo to allow for marchers that can't walk a long distance.  Please bring your bullhorns and we will have chant sheets ready as well as peace keepers to help keep everything non-violent.    The schedule will be:    The DJ will be playing motivating music 30 minutes before then greeting from our MC, four speakers, musical group, march, four speakers and a poet.  There will be numerous political and non-profit tables for information and volunteering.    We need a strong Kalamazoo force to say we are not going back.  We are moving forward for the reproductive rights of all.

title: Keene Women's March
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Women’s Marches will be happening across the country Saturday, October 2nd. Please join us at 11:30AM for a sign-holding event at Central Square in Downtown Keene. We’ll send the Supreme Court and lawmakers across the country a clear, unified message: the attack on our reproductive rights won’t be tolerated. Moreover, we demand equality, fairness, and justice for all.    To protect our community, and especially those too young to be vaccinated, masks are strongly encouraged.    In line with the National Women’s March organization, we recognize that reproductive justice also means justice for queer, trans, and non-binary folks. People of all genders are welcome to join this gathering; we do not believe that “woman” means only those assigned female at birth.    This event will be hosted by State Representative Amanda Elizabeth Toll (electamandanh@gmail.com) and queer racial justice activist and abortion storyteller Sparrow Wilder (spinningflower@yahoo.com).

title: Mohave County Rally for Women's Rights
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights, this is me ovary-acting
notes: On September 1st 2021 the Texas Heartbeat Bill went into effect. This law makes it illegal to obtain an abortion once a fetal heartbeat is detected, unless it is a medical emergency. This law does not make any exclusions for people who became pregnant due to sexual abuse, rape or incest. This law also makes it possible for anyone to file a civil suit against anyone they believe to have performed an abortion or aided in someone getting an abortion after 6 weeks (ie the Uber/Lyft driver that drove you to the appointment).  Texas is the 11th state since 2018 to propose a heartbeat bill and the only state with a heartbeat bill currently in effect. Did you know several states have heartbeat bills on hold due to legal battles?  Arkansas  Oklahoma  South Carolina  Tennessee  Missouri  The time to take a stand is now. Help us spread the message that our government has no business telling us what we can or can not do with our uteruses.    Friendly Reminders:  We welcome everyone to join but please be respectful of others, the park and please please please do not engage in any violent acts.  Also remember to bring water, sunscreen and maybe a chair.  I hope to see you all there!

title: We Won’t Go Back! Knoxville Rally to #DefendRoe
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: *Covid safety guidelines will be followed and masks are required.*    The right to determine for yourself, without government interference, when and if you will become a parent has never been at greater risk in the US. With the decision by the Supreme Court to allow Texas' radical fundamentalist law to stand, people are being forced to make impossible choices if they find themselves with an unexpected pregnancy.     Tennessee is poised to follow In Texas' footsteps with similar legislation that will make the government the ultimate authority over people's family planning decisions if Roe v Wade is overturned.    Knoxville, it's time for us to stand up again to shout that we will not go back!    Join us on Saturday, October 2 at 2:00 pm to raise your voices and to make yourselves absolutely understood: we will not abide by the actions of the radical supermajority that has decided to insert itself into the most intimate of all family decisions.     RSVP Here https://www.weareplannedparenthoodaction.org/a/tn-bans-off-our-bodies

title: Kodiak Women’s March
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: This is a time for Kodiak to come together in solidarity for defending access to reproductive rights. The current attack on reproductive rights is an attack on our bodily autonomy and right to choose. Please join us and March for reproductive freedom. Bring signs, and make your voice heard!     We will be meeting at the KHS Auditorium parking lot where we will March peacefully down Mill Bay to East Addition, then up by baranof toward the middle school and return where we started.     A few important details:     * Given the close proximity we will be with each other, though not required, please consider wearing a mask and social distancing as best as reasonably possible  * Please remain peaceful, this topic can be very divisive  * Do not engage counter protesters   * As we march, please respect traffic laws, do not block traffic     If you support women and reproductive rights, please join us. We thought Roe V Wade settled this decades ago, but many of us are now facing restrictions we never imagined possible. There has never been a greater threat to reproductive rights than this moment.     We hope to see you there!

title: Women's March!
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Women’s March: massive nationwide events to protest Texas assault on reproductive rights. ALL ARE WELCOME- This affects everyone!    We are pleased to announce our intention to hold a brief rally and walk in downtown McMinnville, participating in solidarity with Womens' Marches in many other cities across the nation. Our purpose is to support the reproductive rights of women, and their legal choice in pregnancy to complete or terminate that pregnancy. Given the recent unconstitutional actions by the state of Texas that deny women these rights and the rewarded vigilantism that will enforce their new law, American women's legal reproductive choice is at great risk. This has motivated many women in and around McMinnville to gather to make a public statement taking a stand for our own rights.         At noon on Saturday October 2nd, we plan to gather in the Civic Hall(outdoors) to collect our participants and hold a brief rally. We are currently exploring potential speakers for that rally. Realistically, we anticipate a relatively small crowd, with less than 100 attending. There will be concurrent Womens' Marches in Salem and Portland that will draw large crowds.  Once our rally is finished, we propose to walk en masse up 3rd St to Galloway, Galloway to 2nd, 2nd to Baker, Baker to 3rd, then return to our rallying point at the city park. Upon our return to the park, we expect to disperse, ending this event.  We are asking everyone in attendance to wear a face mask, and position themselves using appropriate social distancing. Participants will also be reminded to behave with courtesy and consideration of our neighbors, particularly while walking adjacent to local businesses and residences.  Should there be "counter protesters" attempting to disrupt our event, our own participants will be directed to not engage, not argue, not escalate. We will conduct ourselves in a calm and respectful manner. We will most certainly contact McMinnville PD if any assistance is needed.

location: Medford Planned Parenthood, 125 S Central Ave
title: Reproductive Rights March
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Now that TX has implemented one of the 6 week abortion bans, we know more states will be quick to follow suit.   The Supreme Court won’t save us.  We must save ourselves!  It's time to take a stand!    !!PLEASE READ BELOW IF YOU HAVE CONCERNS ABOUT THIS EVENT!!     We are always willing to discuss concerns and answer questions from the community, feel free to message one of us if you find the need!    <U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764><U+2764>    While this is a red cloak march, a symbol familiarly used in the handmaid's tale we want to make sure everyone is aware of a few key points about this event.     Firstly, the red cloak is a symbol of reproductive suppression above all else, Margrette Atwood's novel and now the show adaptation has 1 common theme and it is the suppression of people who have the ability to give birth. This event is not in anyway a narrative about her or the actual show or novel because that's not the point, but a way of using a popular image to express the similarities to this fictional dystopia and the very real dystopian future we are headed twords.     This event is ALL inclusive. We are fighting a repressive government that values the life of a zygote more than ANYONE with the ability to actually carry it.  This includes all of our POC, BIPOC, trans, intersex and non binary friends as well as anyone else who will fight for the rights of our neighbors. We are all effected by these restrictive laws, even here in Oregon.      People of color who can carry a pregnancy are among the most targeted groups in this country when it comes down to reproductive rights.     Black women are 4 TIMES more likely to die during child birth, and as we all know the "Father of modern gynecology" used black women to experiment on so rich white women could benefit from the training and research he got from Black women's suffering. These are the issues we are fighting against first and foremost, and the red cloak is just to get their attention.     The whole country is fighting against these laws, and it's our duty to force people to face the grousome reality of what is happening, we cannot let people be comfortable with letting this happen.     Be loud and un-apologetic about protecting reproductive rights for ALL of our people, this is a battle we cannot lose!    <U+2757><U+2757><U+2757>AS PER STATE GUIDELINES, MASKS REQUIRED WHERE SOCIAL DISTANCING NOT POSSIBLE<U+2757><U+2757><U+2757>

title: BANS OFF OUR BODIES- Memphis Rally
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Our bodily autonomy and right to safe, legal abortion is in serious danger. As you have no doubt seen in the news, the Supreme Court turned its back on 50 years of precedent, rendering Roe v. Wade effectively meaningless in Texas. The Supreme Court declined to block the 6-week ban, setting a scary precedent for future court decisions. This law gives anyone in the country, including curbside clinic protestors and abusive partners, the right to sue a Texan who helps someone get an abortion, with an incentive of at least $10,000. Taken alongside the Supreme Court's decision to hear arguments in the Mississippi 15-week ban case, brought by Jackson Women's Health Organization, this fall, our movement is facing a grave threat to abortion access and rights in decades with grave implications for communities across the country.    If we don't act now, Tennessee will be next. The Tennessee legislature passed a “trigger law” that automatically bans abortion as soon as Roe v. Wade is fully or partially overturned. We are facing a possible total abortion ban in Tennessee within a matter of months.    Join us and the Women's March on October 2 to tell Tennessee lawmakers to keep their Bans Off Our Bodies!

title: Bans Off Our Bodies - March for Reproductive Freedom
organizations: Women's March MN; UnRestrict MN; NARAL Pro-Choice MN; Gender Justice; Planned Parenthood North Central States; First Unitarian Society of Minneapolis
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: This is the official Women's March event in the Twin Cities hosted by Women's March MN and several Reproductive Justice groups.    We need to stop the bans like the one in TX from spreading.  Alongside others across the nation, we will march, rally, fight, and be heard. Let’s send a clear message to the Supreme Court and all those who seek to strip citizens of their rights, that reproductive rights are human rights.    Join us on Oct. 2 in Minneapolis. We will begin at 10:00 am for Bans Off Our Bodies t-shirt pickup (order yours now - https://womens-march-mn.square.site/) at the Minneapolis Sculpture Garden and get ready to march at 11:00 am along a .5 accessible route to Loring Park for a rally that starts at noon.    All are welcome to attend and masks are required to keep everyone safe.   The 1/2 mile route is fully accessible and there will be a small accessible seating section with chairs in front of the stage in Loring Park.  An ASL interpreter will also be available on the stage.  Any t-shirts not sold online at the pre-event price will be available onsite at the Sculpture Garden from 10-11:30 and at Loring Park from 11:30-2:00 while supplies last.  Parking is available, but please try to carpool and use public transit whenever possible.    If you would like to help with this action - volunteer - https://tinyurl.com/marchforreprofreedom - or donate today!    Register - https://tinyurl.com/reprofreedom10-2-21 - so that we know you’ll be there and to get updates on details as they roll in.    Get your Bans Off Our Bodies t-shirt - https://womens-march-mn.square.site/! Order by Friday for pickup at the event!    Our partners: Unrestrict MN, Gender Justice, Planned Parenthood Action Fund, NARAL Pro-Choice MN, First Unitarian Society, Our Justice

title: Bans Off Our Bodies: March in Defense of Abortion
organizations: Women's March; Tennessee Advocates for Planned Parenthood
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights, mind your own uterus, Ruth sent us
notes: Attendees should register at this link:  https://www.weareplannedparenthoodaction.org/a/tn-bans-off-our-bodies    *COVID19 is a public health issue. Masks required at this event.*  OUR RIGHT TO SAFE, LEGAL ABORTION IN TENNESSEE IS IN SERIOUS DANGER.  The Supreme Court has failed millions of Texans. In the dead of the night, the Supreme Court turned its back on 50 years of precedent, rendering Roe v. Wade effectively meaningless in Texas. The Supreme Court declined to block the 6-week ban, setting a scary precedent for future court decisions. This law gives anyone in the country, including curbside clinic protestors and abusive partners, the right to sue a Texan who helps someone get an abortion, with an incentive of at least $10,000.  If we don’t act now, Tennessee will be next. The legislature here in Tennessee has a “trigger law” put in place that automatically bans abortion as soon as Roe v. Wade is fully or partially overturned. Governor Bill Lee signed into law an abortion ban last year, which is currently held up in court. This means we are mere months away from a possible total abortion ban in Tennessee.  Join us to march from the State Capitol, to AT&T (who was the largest corporate donor to the sponsors of SB8, the TX abortion ban), and we'll end at the Federal Courthouse. The entire route is 1.2 miles.  In addition, the Supreme Court of the United States has taken on a case from Mississippi centered on a 15-week abortion ban. The case, Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization, is the first major challenge to Roe v. Wade we have seen since significant shifts to our Supreme Court. The case is expected to be heard as early as December with a ruling in 2022.  It's time for us to fight back at a level we never have before. In order to protect our rights and have our voices heard, we have to show up, and show up LOUD. October 2 is days before the SCOTUS term. We are part of a national action, with marches in all 50 states, to let the world know we will NOT stand for judges and politicians controlling our bodies and medical decisions. The time to take action for your reproductive freedom is NOW.

title: March for Reproductive Rights
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Stand with Planned Parenthood in conjunction with the Women's March organization, in support of our local PP clinic - returns to Ottawa on October 2nd to rally in support of reproductive rights.     Marches are being organized in every state two days before the Supreme Court reconvenes for the October term. The event was announced on September 2, the same day Texas’s new abortion legislation went into effect, banning abortions after six weeks and giving Texans the power to sue abortion providers. The Supreme Court voted to uphold the legislation in a 5-4 majority. Texas’s anti-abortion laws are now the most restrictive in the country.    We don’t say this lightly: we're at grave risk of losing our reproductive freedoms. All of us need to fight back.    That's why on October 2nd, in every state we Stand or March in solidarity with women everywhere.    The deets:    Meet at the fountain in the middle of Washington Park at 10:30 AM.  Wear PINK & BLACK!!!!  Bring Signs!      We will stand united with signs, and our smiling faces. Please do not engage in any negative responses, as that is what the other protestors and some walking by will try to do. We reach people with positivity, the second we play into the negativity is the second we loose our message and those willing to listen to us.    The Admins of Stand with Planned Parenthood Ottawa thank you!  *We are not affiliated with any political parties.

notes: REGISTER at bit.ly/miamirepromarch    VOLUNTEER and/or DONATE ITEMS at bit.ly/miamireprovolunteer    Texas abortion ban filed in Florida -> NOW WE MARCH!    Earlier this month, the U.S. Supreme Court allowed the Texas abortion ban, the most restrictive, draconian, extreme abortion law in modern American history, to go into effect.    On September 22nd in the Florida Capitol, Rep. Webster Barnaby (R-Deltona) filed HB167, a mirror of the Texas abortion ban that he and other Florida legislative leaders want to make the law of the land in our state. These attacks on reproductive freedom are a clarion call for Floridians from all walks of life to take action.     Please join reproductive rights advocates on Saturday, October 2nd at 2PM the Gazebo Area near the 77th Ave entrance at Coral Reef Park. Let’s take a stand together for reproductive health and freedom!    (Yes, there was a location change).    Masks are required. Social distancing will be respected. Hand sanitizer will be provided.        Hosted By a Coalition of Miami Organizations Including: ACLU of Greater Miami, Florida Rising, Latina Institute for Reproductive Justice Florida, League of Women Voters Miami-Dade, Miami-Dade County Commission for Women, Miami Workers Center, National Council of Jewish Women (NCJW) Miami, , Planned Parenthood South, East, and North Florida, Seminole Tribe of Florida, Southern Birth Justice Network, TransSocial, Women's Emergency Network, Women’s March Florida and Women's March Miami

title: Roanoke Rally for Reproductive Rights
organizations: Roanoke Indivisible; Women’s March on Roanoke
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: This event is designed to be a sister rally to show our support for the National  Women's March Organization. Our focus is on reproductive rights for all women, thus we are calling it the Roanoke Rally for Reproductive Rights. In simplest terms, we believe that every woman should be able to choose what is right for her. We do not  believe that others should dictate what healthcare resources are legally available to them. Our priorities are safety and well being for everyone, both in the present and in the future. We expect to have a voter registration booth, educational materials to disperse, speakers to share their stories, and we are doing our absolute best to create a general atmosphere that promotes respect, responsibility, safety, and integrity. We know this is a highly controversial topic and we are trying to promote a socio-cultural shift that encourages people to kindly respect and support women who have to make what is often one of the most difficult decisions of their lives. We also know we cannot do it alone, that part is obvious. We are working tirelessly to collaborate with various members of the community to make this event meaningful and lead to people being authentically passionate about guiding others to find that intrinsic motivation within themselves and push for lasting, concrete changes in our community. We are grateful for everyone who has made the commitment to stand beside other women even through these incredibly challenging times. We humbly request your attendance on October 2nd, 2021 at the location listed below. Please RSVP so that we can allot appropriate time and resources for everyone. We look forward to seeing you there!

title: March & Rally for Abortion Justice
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: ON OCTOBER 2nd, people are marching in every single state ahead of the Supreme Court reconvening on October 4th. Our goal is to send a message to the country and to the Supreme Court that abortion is essential healthcare, and the criminalization and policing of abortion, abortion providers and pregnant people’s choices is anti-democratic and unacceptable.    WE'RE RISING UP and making ourselves loud and clear: we won’t tolerate attacks on abortion access. Period.    Make signs and bring a bullhorn!     ***COVID masks are required.***    **NO coat hangers   **NO handmaids tale red coats    LOCAL SPONSORS include:  - Indivisible Rochester  - Metro Justice  - National Organization for Women Rochester Chapter  - Planned Parenthood of Central and Western NY  - Senator Samra G. Brouk's Office  - Webster Democratic Committee    THANK YOU for answering the call and joining forces with Women's March and <U+FEFF>more than 110 other organizations, including National Latina Institute for Reproductive Justice, <U+FEFF>Planned Parenthood, SisterSong, We Demand More, Working Families Party, and The Frontline as we rise up on October 2 in defense of our reproductive rights.    PLEASE CONTACT US if you’d like to be a volunteer, safety marshall, speak at the rally, or your organization would like to sponsor this event. We welcome supportive involvement!    This page is continuously being updated - check back for latest info!

title: RALLY FOR ROE - Planned Parenthood with Women's March Sacramento & a local pro-choice coalition
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: A COVID-SAFE VIRTUAL RALLY AND CARAVAN TO DEFEND ABORTION RIGHTS   Hosted by Planned Parenthood Advocates Mar Monte & a local pro-choice healthcare coalition        What do we want? Abortion justice. When do we need it? NOW!    Fight back against anti-choice extremists and stand up for reproductive justice!    Join Planned Parenthood Advocates Mar Monte and our community partners: Access Reproductive Justice, Women's Health Specialists, and Women's March Sacramento as together we stand up for reproductive rights!    Together we must stand with people across the nation for reproductive rights and abortion justice.    #BansOffOurBodies    #ReproductiveJustice      On October 2, Sacramento’s ‘lower than safe vaccination rates’ aren’t going to stop us from sending the Supreme Court and lawmakers across the country a clear, unified message. The attack on our reproductive rights will not be tolerated.      *Please check the disclaimer for rules per the Capitol and City required guidelines*      SUBSCRIBE FOR THE LATEST UPDATES: www.womensmarchsac.com/subscribe    Date: Saturday. October 2, 2021      Location: Your Home and then Your “Reproductive Justice Decorated” vehicle.      SCHEDULE OF EVENTS:      10AM: RALLY! TV Channel 17, streaming from AccessSacramento.org or on RoKU and IPTV, Apple TV+ from the SCREENWEAVE identity, or Live on Facebook!   https://www.facebook.com/PPAdvocatesMM        2PM: CARAVAN with 96.5FM! From the Amtrak parking lot at 5th and I Street, cruise in loops from the US Courthouse & Federal Building to the CA State Capitol, while on KUBU 96.5 FM in midtown, on the stream from AccessSacramento.org, and on the app KUBU 965 FM, free from the google play store or apple app store.            Although registration is not required to attend the event, we’re asking for participants to register on Eventbrite so we can have an accurate count to plan for proper accommodations.    Please register for this volunteer-led grassroots event so that we can get a headcount, and please consider donating $5 or more either here or at www.womensmarchsac.com so that we can afford PPE, professional audio and filming, and pay for logistics and insurance! Any proceeds after event costs are covered will be donated to a CA pro-choice fund that  serves marginalized clients with uteruses. Donations and sponsorships are tax deductible, as Women's March Sacramento is a project of a 501(c)3 nonprofit - Social Good Fund.    DONATE: www.womensmarchsac.com/donate    ADVERTISING AND SPONSORSHIP:  www.womensmarchsac.com/tabling    Contingents: Coordinate decorations of cars, bikes, and trucks and, register your organization to be listed      Accessibility: Closed Captioning will be made available for the rally. For pandemic safety, masks the cover the nose and mouth are required at all times when near people outside your household. Extra masks will be available in the First Aid and Information Tents.      Disclaimer: Please remain in your vehicle at all times during the caravan, and please always keep 6 feet of social distance from any person who is not in your household and wear a face mask to cover your nose and mouth. Please limit sticks on signs or flags to 18 inches of wood from the bottom of the sign or flag. By choosing to attend this event, you are acknowledging the risks involved, and you are committing to participate nonviolently and in accordance with the law, and to work to de-escalate confrontations with counter protesters or others.    You agree (i) not to engage in any act of violence or violation of any applicable law, (ii) to obey the orders of authorized event marshals and law enforcement authorities, (iii) that Planned Parenthood and Women’s March Sacramento or Social Good Fund organizers and affiliate organizations will not be responsible for any injury or damage to your person or property resulting from or occurring in the course of your participating in the event; and you agree to release and forever hold harmless Planned Parenthood, Women’s March Sacramento, Social Good Fund, affiliated organizations, and their respective officers, directors, employees and agents from liability for any such injury or damage.    info@womensmarchsac.com

title: Bans off our bodies
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: On October 2, we're marching in every single state ahead of the Supreme Court reconvening on October 4. Women's March and more than 90 other organizations, including National Latina Institute for Reproductive Justice, Planned Parenthood, SHERO Mississippi, Mississippi in Action, Access Reproductive Care-Southeast, The Frontline, Working Families Party, and SisterSong, are organizing a national call to mobilize and defend our reproductive rights.     Abortion has never been fully accessible, but we are at the risk of losing our reproductive freedom completely. The call to action is clear, and urgent. The relentless attacks from Texas to Mississippi are ramping up quickly. Anti-choice extremists have a deep desire to return to a time when there was more clear and effective domination and control over queer and trans folks, women, and people of color; they want to revive those old values and societal norms to the point of re-acceptance. The authoritarian agenda of reproductive control is fueled by misogyny and racism - and we must challenge it, together.    On October 2, we’re going to send the Supreme Court and lawmakers across the country a clear, unified message. The attack on our reproductive rights will not be tolerated.

title: Show Up, Fight Back: Stop the Bans Rally
organizations: Stop the Bans Coalition; Advocates of Planned Parenthood of the St. Louis Region and Southwest Missouri; Access Missouri; Action St. Louis; ACLU of Missouri; Pro-Choice Missouri
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: We're coming together on Saturday morning, October 2, to #StopTheBans and support reproductive freedom for every Missourian.    In the weeks since the U.S. Supreme Court allowed Texas to enforce its "flagrantly unconstitutional" six-week abortion ban, Texans who need an abortion have had to leave the state to access care. The impact is being felt right here in the Midwest, with an increase in abortion patients from from Texas. The Eighth Circuit Court of Appeals, just one step from the Supreme Court, will soon consider whether to let Missouri's extreme abortion ban take effect. Now is the time to act — join the #StopTheBans Coalition and let's fight back together!    To sign up, RSVP here: https://www.weareplannedparenthoodaction.org/a/st-louis-stopthebans-march    Organizations can co-sponsor this event by joining the #StopTheBans Coalition: https://bit.ly/StopTheBans

title: Bans Off Our Bodies: March for Abortion Justice
organizations: San Antonio Women's March; Planned Parenthood of South Texas
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Our march is one mile square: https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/edit?mid=1OsWa2_14PvqKLb6HKdAiP8VG8XNAXSIS&usp=sharing    In conjunction with sister marches all over the country, we march on October 2nd, 2021, to defend our access to abortions. As an official chapter of the National Women's March, we will host the Bans Off Our Bodies: Women's March of South Texas and join the national call to action to mobilize and defend our reproductive rights.    March will begin and end at Milam Park. Gather at 11:30 a.m.  https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/edit?mid=1OsWa2_14PvqKLb6HKdAiP8VG8XNAXSIS&usp=sharing    Bring a water bottle and please stay hydrated!!!    Wear comfortable clothing and walking shoes.    Posters, signs, banners, and noisemakers are strongly encouraged.    Wear a mask!!! We will have masks and hand sanitizer available and will follow all CDC Covid-19 guidelines.    Wear Orange!! Why Wear Orange?  Orange is the color that represents the fight for access to safe & legal abortions in Texas since the 2013 Wendy Davis' thirteen-hour-long filibuster to block Senate Bill 5, a measure which included more restrictive abortion regulations for Texas. We continue wearing orange to honor and continue that fight.    If you would like to wear your own costume or outfit please honor these guidelines: No Handmaiden Outfits & avoid hangers and the appearance of the dangers of illegal abortions - Per Women's March National.  Here's some articles why:   Handmaiden imagery pushes a white agenda that ignores the historic and on-going harm to POC.  We want to uplift and honor the struggle of the most affected - not detract.  https://nyunews.com/opinion/2021/09/09/texas-handmaids-tale-white-feminism/    Hangers are great fodder for patronizing anti-choice rhetoric.  https://www.salon.com/2019/05/09/abortion-war-heats-up-and-coat-hanger-argument-is-backfiring-on-pro-choice-movement/    That said, this is your march and you can express what you need to express.
