March For Our Rights  ~A Community Organized March for Reproductive Justice~  Saturday, October 2, 2021 at 11 AM   SF Civic Center Plaza Area  <Masks Required>     >Line up will start at 10:45 AM at Grove St & Hyde St  >March starts at 11 AM SHARP from Grove St & Hyde St  >March down Market St to Embarcadero Plaza [end march]    **We will NOT have an in person Rally before or after the March and we ask the community's help to disperse at the end of the march**    To RSVP & get more information please RSVP using either Facebook or Eventbrite. title: MARCH FOR REPRODUCTIVE RIGHTS SAN JOSE
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights, my body my choice, keep your laws out of my vagina, get ovary it, abortion is a human right
notes: Please note: Details for March Route and Rally info will be updated ASAP.-     On Oct 2, along with organizations throughout the nation, were marching ahead of the Supreme Court reconvening on Oct 4. Women's March San José along with Enough Is Enough Voter Project, Action Together Bay Area and Pandia Health are organizing this call to mobilize and defend our reproductive rights in San José.  Abortion has never been fully accessible, but we are at the risk of losing our reproductive freedom completely. The call to action is clear, and urgent. The relentless attacks from Texas to Mississippi are ramping up quickly. Anti-choice extremists have a deep desire to return to a time when there was more clear and effective domination and control over queer and trans folks, women, and people of color; they want to revive those old values and societal norms to the point of re-acceptance. The authoritarian agenda of reproductive control is fueled by misogyny and racism - and we must challenge it, together.  On Oct 2, we’re going to send the Supreme Court and lawmakers across the country a clear, unified message. The attack on our reproductive rights will not be tolerated.  We have this opportunity to invite all the people that know us and love us into this important movement and work united as we build something better for our families and communities. As a small powerful group tries to come for our human rights over and over again, we’ll never let go of our vision of reproductive justice; for unfettered abortion access and everything we need to support and grow our families to thrive and live healthy lives.  This is your fight. This is our fight. This impacts all of us. Please join us and rise up on Oct 2.   We are requesting all participants wear a mask. Thank you in advance  for your cooperation in keeping us all safe.    If your group or organization is interested in partnering with us, please fill out the form on our webpage at https://www.enoughisenoughvoter.org/march

title: Support Our Texas Sisters - Masks Mandatory
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: UPDATE  09/24--            Reading from "The Worst of Times"             by Patricia G. Miller     Women, motherless family members, doctors, coroners, and police officers tell stories about what it was like when abortion was illegal.    We will have signs which will stress what we are for, not what we are against. Men are welcome.    Wear masks, bring water, and tissues ( you will hear some tragic stories, feel free to cry).    To protect our health, we will not sing or chant,  we will hum and sway instead. If everyone knows "There is a Balm in Gilead" we can hum that, at the beginning, if not we can "ohm."     SEPT. 24  UPDATE STARTS HERE---    Readings will be interspersed with songs.    WHEN THE MUSIC STARTS, SWAY, DANCE IN PLACE, HUM, BUT PLEASE DO NOT SING--WE WANT TO STAY HEALTHY.    Please download this playlist to your phone. title: Rally for Reproductive Rights 2021 - Stamford
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Pink Wave Action, Indivisible Stamford, Indivisible Greenwich, Allies for Justice & Equity CT and ICT4 presents: Rally for Reproductive Rights 2021 - Stamford      Rally with us on October 2, 2021 at 10:30 AM at the Judicial District Courthouse in Stamford, CT  where we will send the Supreme Court and lawmakers across the country a clear, unified message: the attack on our reproductive rights will not be tolerated.     This year, as Roe vs. Wade hangs by a thread, our communities will stand as a united front.       The relentless attacks from Texas to Mississippi are ramping up quickly. Anti-choice extremists have a deep desire to return to a time when there was more clear and effective domination and control over queer and trans folks, women, and people of color; they want to revive those old values and societal norms to further marginalize those who are already isolated from accessible, quality healthcare, reproductive autonomy, and safe & legal abortions. The authoritarian agenda of reproductive control is fueled by misogyny and racism - and we must challenge it, together.     Abortion has never been fully accessible to all, but we are at the risk of losing our reproductive freedom completely. The call to action has never been more urgent.      We MUST get out the vote in favor of reproductive freedom and accessible healthcare for all. Today and everyday, we are sending a clear message to our lawmakers and the Supreme Court: The People’s Rights for Reproductive Freedom will stand!     Visit PinkWave.org for more info.    Sign up here for updates on location and what you can do to save reproductive rights!

From income inequality to racial justice to the environment, it is all impacted by access to legal, affordable, destigmatized abortion. No one can get an abortion in Texas after 6 weeks.  Nine states only have one abortion clinic. Birth control is on the line. Clinics providing birth control, STD screening and referrals to get an abortion are already permanently shut down in many states. The Supreme Court reconvenes on October 4th and all of us must show up to support reproductive freedom.   Masks Required  Do not block the street or parking or businesses.  Do not bring coat hanger or handmaiden tale signs or outfits: See our Facebook post comments for details.   Do not engage with counter protesters.  Thank you!

title: Tucson Women’s March
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: WE ARE MARCHING in Tucson, Arizona.   On September 1, 2021, the latest and most egregious law opposing freedom of choice went into effect in Texas. Texas SB8 allows private citizens to police the actions of anyone who helps a woman obtain an abortion after 6 weeks gestation. The law permits and encourages civil lawsuits against medical providers, drivers, family and friends of women who are exercising their right to choose granted to them under the 14th Amendment as affirmed by Roe v. Wade in 1973. Citing “procedural questions,” the United States Supreme Court refused to provide relief from the law, despite its obvious unconstitutionality. Several state legislatures, including our legislature in Arizona, have signaled that they will use the Texas law as framework for their own abortion bans. We know that abortion bans are about power over people with uteruses and our right to reproductive freedom. We know that laws like SB8 are just the beginning of the latest assault on our right to choose. So, WE ARE MARCHING.    Join us on Saturday, October 2nd at 10:00 am at Armory Park. This event does not include a rally. Rather, we have organized a peaceful procession with our own safety marshaling so that police are not involved and everyone can feel safe and welcome. We will obey all traffic ordinances. Our route is accessible, and we will have extra help available for anyone who needs assistance participating in the march. This is an all ages event, with signs and chants which will be safe for anyone from ages 2 to 102. Every human is welcome to march with us! In accordance with the CDC and the Women’s March National Organization, we will be observing COVID-19 safety protocols. Masks are required for participants, and social distancing will be observed wherever possible.     We will march from Armory Park to Jacome Plaza in Downtown Tucson. Wear comfortable shoes and make a plan for hydration. Please see below for the COVID-19 guidelines, straight from The Women’s March National Organization:    We are marching as a demonstration of our love and commitment to each other. We also know we are in a devastating and terrifying surge of the Delta variant. We can hold both.  In order to protect and care for each other, we require that all participants wear masks, maintain proper social distance, and use hand sanitizer before passing anything out or touching any shared objects like bullhorns or banners. These common-sense guidelines are non-negotiable, a reflection of our deep commitment to keeping each other safe.    We have merchandise! Local, community-minded print shop The Gloo Factory has graciously handled our merchandise. You can order from them online at: https://peacesupplies.org/womens-march/ or you can purchase your items in store at 238 E. 26th St. in Tucson.     We would also like to thank our Sponsor, Michael Rubin with The Rubin Group. Thanks to his generous donation, we will be better able to keep you safe and hydrated on the day of the march! https://www.fairwayindependentmc.com/Michael-Rubin

title: Utqiagvik's March for Reproductive Rights
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Our human rights are under attack! Right now we are facing the worst attacks on our bodily autonomy, our right to choose when and how to have a family, and our access to basic and safe health care in the form of abortions that we've seen in 50 years.    We don’t say this lightly: We are at grave risk of losing our reproductive freedom completely. From local abortion bans being passed in states like Texas and Mississippi, to the highest court in our land refusing to defend our constitutional rights – we are witnessing the most direct and dire threats to our reproductive health in our lifetimes. Politicians will not stop after destroying our reproductive rights but will continue to create legislation in order to control all aspects of our lives.    The devastating abortion ban we saw enacted in Texas last week is just one of over 90 egregious and harmful anti-abortion bills enacted across the country this year alone, with over 400 more bills in state legislatures right now-- including one in Alaska to amend our State Constitution.    We are at a pivotal moment in history. We can be defined as the generation that stood against tyranny and disinformation. We can be known for fighting for what is right, for our community, for our right to choose. Stand in solidarity with us and use your voice to dismantle the unjust system of oppression designed to hold us down!    A few important details:  *In order to protect all our participants, we are encouraging everyone to wear face coverings and social distance.  *As we march, please respect traffic laws. At intersections, wait for the "walk" light; do not block traffic.    Please feel free to reach out and contact us on our Facebook page: https://fb.me/e/1DRdt09YL

title: Rally for Women's/LGBTQ+ Rights to Keep and Access Legal Abortion
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: Mark your calendars for Planned Parenthood Alliance Advocates - Alaska’s statewide DAY OF ACTION on Saturday October 2nd. Marches will be held on this day across the nation, because our right to access safe, legal abortion is in the most serious danger it has been in 48 years. Almost five decades ago, the Supreme Court said that your constitutional right to privacy extended to your right to access an abortion. This year, the Supreme Court reconvenes on October 4th and will be hearing a case on a 15-week abortion ban in Mississippi. With the addition of three new conservative justices it is possible the court will overturn all or parts of Roe v Wade and eliminate access to safe and legal abortion for millions across the country.  The devastating abortion ban we saw enacted in Texas last week is just one of over 90 egregious and harmful anti-abortion bills enacted across the country this year alone, with over 400 more bills in state legislatures right now-- including one in Alaska to amend our State Constitution.    Abortion rights across the United States-- including here in Alaska-- are under attack. But we’re not giving up!    We will be holding events in communities across the state! We look forward to finding ways to safely support each other, get loud, find joy and catharsis, and tell our legislators across Alaska to keep their #BansOffOurBodies! Guests, please remember that trans men, non-binary people and more LGBTQ+ can get pregnant and can have an abortion, meaning that this is an LGBTQ+ issue just as much as a women's issue.   Peaceful expression of art, music, signage etc. welcome. Musicians welcome to bring instruments, drums, etc. No transphobia allowed. Please wear a mask and social distance.

title: Mobilize and Defend - Women’s March
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: On October 2, we're marching right here in Waco, TX ahead of the Supreme Court reconvening on October 4. Planned Parenthood, Centex Action Network, and others who are organizing a call to mobilize and defend our reproductive rights.     Abortion has never been fully accessible, but we are at the risk of losing our reproductive freedom completely. The call to action is clear, and urgent. The relentless attacks from Texas to Mississippi are ramping up quickly. Anti-choice extremists have a deep desire to return to a time when there was more clear and effective domination and control over queer and trans folks, women, and people of color; they want to revive those old values and societal norms to the point of re-acceptance. The authoritarian agenda of reproductive control is fueled by misogyny and racism - and we must challenge it, together.    On October 2, we're going to send the Supreme Court and lawmakers across the country a clear, unified message. The attack on our reproductive rights will not be tolerated.    We have this opportunity to invite all the people that know us and love us into this important movement and work united as we build something better for our families and communities. As a small powerful group tries to come for our human rights over and over again, we’ll never let go of our vision of reproductive justice; for unfettered abortion access and everything we need to support and grow our families to thrive and live healthy lives.    This is your fight. This is our fight. This impacts all of us. Rise up wherever you are on October 2.     Are you a vendor? Vendor questions or requests may reach Cassaundra Dawn Robertson Cassiedrobertson@yahoo.com

title: March for Reproductive Freedom
claims: against Texas abortion ban, for reproductive rights, for women's rights
notes: In solidarity with the National Women's March.   Texas SB8 bans abortion after 6 weeks, before most women know they are even pregnant. It makes no exceptions for rape or incest, and effectively places bounties on women and anyone caught helping women seek an abortion.   It is one of the most concerning bills for women's rights in modern times. Placing the enforcement of this bill onto the citizens, in or out of Texas, rather than the government creates terrifying situations for women and bypasses federal oversight.   On October 2nd at noon, Yakima citizens will be gathering at Miller Park to show their solidarity.

title: CLIMATE JUSTICE VIGIL ON STEPS OF CHURCH OF THE COVENANT, 67 Newbury Street: Sunday, October 17, Noon.
claims: for climate justice, for religious values
notes: CLIMATE JUSTICE VIGIL ON THE STEPS OF CHURCH OF THE COVENANT. Please join us for this vigil in solidarity with GreenFaith's nation-wide "Faiths 4 Climate Justice" weekend: https://greenfaith.org/faiths4climatejustice/ Our 30 minute vigil will take place outside on our church steps at the corner of Newbury and Berkeley Streets at Noon on 10/17/21. Also, if you can, please  bring along something to make “a sacred sound” (bell, prayer bowl, drum, shofar, etc.) and bring any signs to hold to show downtown Boston how we as people of faith are serious about climate justice for all. Please RSVP here (https://greenfaith.controlshift.app/events/faiths-4-climate-justice-17)

location: Boulder County Courthouse; Boulder Peace Garden
title: GreenFaith Boulder County: Faiths 4 Climate Justice
claims: for climate justice, for religious values
notes: Join a Day of Global Sacred Action with an interfaith gathering beginning at the Boulder County Courthouse on Pearl St. We will raise our voices in song, prayer, and love for the earth. We will process to Broadway and Canyon with our banners and signs and hearts. Speaking the sacred "no" to destructive forces of fossil fuel projects. Speaking "yes" to the sacred guidance given to us in so many of the world's religions and spiritual traditions, "yes" to the Great Turning, "yes" to the more beautiful world our hearts know is possible. Opening to support of the greater-than-human world, we come together to know we are not alone and to stand with more than 430 actions all over this beautiful garden in space called Earth. 3:00pm gathering + speakers at Boulder County Courthouse 1325 Pearl Street - Welcome & Opening remarks - GreenFaith Boulder County - Zen priest and climate scientist Sensei Kritee Kanko will speak about climate justice.- Jungian psychotherapist, author and Jewish Renewal Rabbi Tirzah Firestone will provide the call to action.- Songleader, storyteller and ecopsychologist, Dr. Tina Fields will lead the gathering in song. 3:30-3:45pm procession to stand vigil at corner(s) of Broadway and Canyon Blvd. - We bring our message to the streets and stand with people of faith and spirit throughout the world - We will have signs and banners calling for climate justice and an end to the use of fossil fuels for the sake of the Earth and all beings. - Bring bells, shofars, drums and other instruments to sound the call to action if you would like. 4:30-4:45pm procession to Boulder International Peace Garden by the Library for closing ceremony (1021 Arapahoe - south side of Boulder Creek) - We honor our inter-relationship with the Earth and with all life with a water offering. - Bring fall leaves, flowers, earth-friendly offerings for bark boats to send gratitude and love to the water and prayers to future generations. - Songleader, storyteller and ecopsychologist, Dr. Tina Fields will offer song. - Professor Sherry Ellms, Faculty Lead for the Joanna Macy Center for Resilience and Regeneration and Associate Professor at Naropa University, will offer one of Joanna Macy's favorite Rainer Maria Rilke poems to close.

title: Walk Across the Mahicantuck (Hudson River)
claims: for climate justice, for religious values
notes: RAIN - OR - SHINE: with the forecast for possible showers, bring your umbrella! This Faiths 4 Climate Justice event is being organized by the "inter-faith break-out group" at the July 22nd meeting of the Environmental Crisis Planning Forum co-hosted by Basilica Hudson, the Columbia Land Conservancy, and the Buddhist Action Coalition. In the afternoon of Sunday, October 17, those of us within the Upper Hudson Valley and surrounding hills will assemble along the Mahicantuck (Hudson River) to raise our collective voice for climate justice as we walk across the Rip Van Winkle Bridge. Bring a small drum or a tambourine or a small bell to ring… and a sign or small banner from your faith group or environmental organization. Assemble at 3:30: two groups will assemble - one on each end of the bridge - for a brief statement of purpose... scroll down for more information on assembly locations. Walk at 3:50: both groups will begin walking toward the center of the Rip Van Winkle Bridge. Reflection at 4:15: when both groups connect at the middle, we will stop for a moment of silence followed with the sound of drums, tambourines, and bells. Walk at 4:25: both groups will return to their beginning points. Reassemble 4:50: both groups will assemble - one on each end of the bridge - for a brief benediction.

title: Faiths 4 Climate Justice: Multi-Faith Prayer Gathering
claims: for climate justice, for religious values
notes: Two weeks before the international UN Climate Talks, and following the “People vs. Fossil Fuels” week of action in Washington DC, this is the time to unite in calling for a just transition from fossil fuels. At noon on Monday, October 18, join people of faith and spirituality at the entrance to the Federal Building in Minneapolis. Together, we will call on President Biden to stop fossil fuels and ensure a just transition to a healthy climate and economy. Through song, prayer, meditation, and silence, we will make a public stand for climate justice and a livable world. Afterwards, please join us for a prayer walk across the Stone Arch Bridge to Father Hennepin Bluff Park (a 20-minute walk) for community time together. Lunch will be provided (with a free-will offering). Masks will be required, and all activities will be outdoors. Main event page is at our MNIPL website: www.mnipl.org/event/faiths-4-climate-justice/

title: Jewish Youth Rising
claims: for climate justice, for religious values, for divesting BlackRock from fossil fuels
notes: Join Jewish Youth Climate Movement and GreenFaith at 8:15 am on Monday, October 18th at 345 Park Avenue in New York City for a Jewish youth-led action demanding that BlackRock's CEO Larry Fink ends its funding of the fossil fuel industry and human rights violations. BlackRock is the world’s largest asset manager and funder of the fossil industry and companies tied to deforestation. BlackRock also contributes to major human rights violations, including abusing indigenous territorial rights and displacing communities from their ancestral homelands. Our demands: 1.  Take Climate Action Now, not share plans for the distant future 2.  Stop investing in dirty fossil fuels 3.  Nix the net, maximize the zero 4.  Stop companies from continued destruction of our forests and respect Indigenous rights We will be disrupting business as usual. There is no exact end time for this action. This action is part of Faiths 4 Climate Justice, where people of diverse religions around the world will rise together in a global, grassroots, multi-faith action demanding that governments and financial institutions do more, two weeks before the UN climate talks. If you have questions about the action, contact us at jycm@hazon.org COVID SAFETY: To ensure the safety of everyone involved, we're requiring that everyone wears face masks and that everyone is vaccinated (if eligible for the vaccine).

title: Human Prayer Chain for Climate Justice
claims: for climate justice, for religious values
notes: On Monday, October 18 at 5:00 p.m., people of faith will form a socially distanced Human Prayer Chain for Climate Justice along Wade Avenue in Raleigh, North Carolina. Participants will assemble at the Unitarian Universalist Fellowship of Raleigh (UUFR, 3313 Wade Ave.) and Community United Church of Christ (CUCC, 814 Dixie Trail) and space themselves at 6 foot intervals. We will extend as far down Wade Avenue as we have souls to take us!  At 6:00 local clergy will lead a short Outdoor Prayer Vigil for Climate Justice at UUFR for all those who wish to join. Masks are highly encouraged for the socially distanced prayer chain and required for the socially distanced prayer vigil. Parking will be available at UUFR and CUCC.  Come on your own or with your creation care team.  Encourage your clergy to announce it in the weekend service and to come to the prayer chain in religious dress.   Register here:  https://interfaithcreationcare.org/prayer-chain/
